titlestmt.titleproper: A Guide to the John D. Gregory papers, Rockefeller University Faculty FA163
titlestmt.author: BJG

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on 2019-03-14 00:20:59 -0400.

change.item: Paper finding aid converted to EAD/XML by AureXus in 2010. Imported into the Archvistsâ€™ Toolkit by Becky Robbins.

did.unittitle: John D. Gregory papers, Rockefeller University Faculty

arrangement.head: Arrangement note
arrangement.p: Collection is arranged in one Series.
Material is further arranged in chronological order.

bioghist.head: Biographical / Historical
bioghist.p: John D. Gregory, associate professor, works on the biochemistry of connective tissues. Connective tissues make up a significant part of the body's substance and provide the body with essential support structures. In his early research, Dr. Gregory developed new techniques for extracting proteoglycans from cartilage tissue and for determining their chemical composition. Proteglycans play an important role in the cornea and the skin, and Dr. Gregory has worked on characterizing their chemical compositions in both organs to help explain degenerative changes.
In 1971, Dr. Gregory became the President of the Rockefeller University's Chapter of the Society of the Sigma Xi and in 1976 became the President of The Society for Complex Carbohydrates.

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access note
accessrestrict.p: Access to this collection is restricted pending permission from Rockefeller University.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Information regarding the Rockefeller Archive Center's preferred elements and forms of citation can be found at http://www.rockarch.org/research/citations.php

processinfo.head: Processing Information
processinfo.p: Level 1 Processing has been conducted to gain basic intellectual and physical control of the materials and assess immediate preservation needs. Material remains as received, in original folders and storage boxes.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This collection is comprised entirely of reprints.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Includes reprints; also includes a list of reprints from 1947 to 1987.
